message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the properties of light and how it behaves. When a source of light becomes closer, it will appear brighter or more luminous. This is because the light that is emitted from the source has less distance to travel before it reaches our eyes, resulting in a stronger and more intense perception of the light. Option (B) is unrelated to the topic of light. Option (C) is incorrect because as a source of light gets closer, it will actually appear brighter, not darker. Option (D) is unrelated to the topic of light.

Option (C) is incorrect because as the source gets closer, the light will become more intense, not darker. Option (D) is unrelated as sound has nothing to do with the perception of light.
